name: Lufthansa 747-8i [D-ABYL] Powerful Cloudy Takeoff from Frankfurt! ᴴᴰ
description:
My very first flight on the 747-8 Intercontinental! The flight was very pleasant, although we left about 30 minutes late due to, what the captain told us, was crowded skies over the UK that day. Those clouds that you can see during the taxi are quite menacing, but thankfully the captain avoided the worst of it. This video features a head-on look at the aircraft from the terminal, a very fast pushback, the full taxi to the runway, with close ups of several aircraft, and finally, the takeoff roll and climb out, with the flaps retracting. I hope you enjoy, and watch in high definition!

Thanks for watching! Please comment, rate, and subscribe!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFO
Airline: Lufthansa (DLH/LH)
Aircraft: Boeing 747-8 Intercontinental
Aircraft Name: "Hessen"
Livery: Standard
Engines: 4x GEnx-2B67
Seat: 30K
Registration: D-ABYL 
Route: FRA-ORD
Callsign: Lufthansa 430 Heavy
Runway used: 25C
Taxiway(s) used: N8, L, L1
FlightAware: http://flightaware.com/live/flight/DABYL

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

VIDEO LOG: 
00:13 - Exterior head-on view of our aircraft
00:50 - Pushback commences, surprisingly fast
02:28 - Hopefully we're not flying into those clouds...
02:58 - Flaps begin extending, and flight controls are checked
03:40 - Flaps fully extended
03:45 - Taxi begins
05:15 - After passing several Lufthansa jumbos sitting at their gates, we pass the Lufthansa Technik hangar
05:50 - A Condor 757-300 in their new livery! I still think grey and yellow is a strange combination for an airline livery.
06:20 - Turning onto Taxiway Lima
08:15 - Zooming in on a US Airways A330-200 taxiing slightly faster than us
09:15 - Zooming in on aircraft at the remote stands on the south side of the airport
09:17 - B-2047: One of Air China's many aircraft in special liveries, this one celebrating the relations between China and France.
10:06 - Lufthansa A380-800 D-AIMG (again!) departs in front of us, with some pretty sweet water spray.
11:04 - D-AIMG lifts off from 25C, as we line up.
12:14 - Lined up and ready to go.
12:40 - Takeoff power is applied to the 4 GEnx-2B67 engines
13:24 - Rotation, after a bumpy 44 second takeoff roll
14:00 - Climbing away, making a right turn, Runway 07L/26R visible
14:40 - Into the clouds we go!
15:10 - Flaps retracting
16:03 - Flaps fully retracted

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-
